block.p: Dr. Carla Marie Narrett, a college dean, and Dr. Walter Richard Ott, a college provost, were married yesterday. Judge Harold Kuskin of the New Jersey Tax Court in Morristown officiated at Arthur's Landing, a restaurant in Weehawken, N.J.

Dr. Narrett, who is keeping her name, is the dean of the graduate school and of research at Montclair State University in Upper Montclair, N.J. She graduated summa cum laude from Northern Michigan University and received master's and doctoral degrees in school psychology from Syracuse University. She is the daughter of Lucille Belpedio of Ishpeming, Mich., and the late Peter M. Belpedio. Her father was a miner for the Cleveland-Cliffs Iron Company in Ishpeming, in Michigan's Upper Peninsula.

Dr. Carla Marie Narrett, a college dean, and Dr. Walter Richard Ott, a college provost, were married yesterday. Judge Harold Kuskin of the New Jersey Tax Court in Morristown officiated at Arthur's Landing, a restaurant in Weehawken, N.J.

Dr. Narrett, who is keeping her name, is the dean of the graduate school and of research at Montclair State University in Upper Montclair, N.J. She graduated summa cum laude from Northern Michigan University and received master's and doctoral degrees in school psychology from Syracuse University. She is the daughter of Lucille Belpedio of Ishpeming, Mich., and the late Peter M. Belpedio. Her father was a miner for the Cleveland-Cliffs Iron Company in Ishpeming, in Michigan's Upper Peninsula.

Dr. Ott, who is known as Richard, is the provost and vice president for academic affairs at Alfred University in Alfred, N.Y. He graduated from Virginia Polytechnic University and received two graduate degrees in ceramic engineering, a master's from the University of Illinois and a Ph.D. from Rutgers University. He is a son of Mary Butler Ott of Lakewood, N.J., and the late Harold Ott, who was the vice president for personnel at the King's Highway Savings Bank in Brooklyn.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce, as did that of the bride.
